caption: DL;DR You are in the Marais and looking for a place to take a break? This is your spot I found this place the first time when I was looking for a place to eat the eclairs that I bought in the Eclair de Jenie, which is a great place just around the corner I like the way that in is actually hidden from the street and you have this narrow pass way to get in Like all the gardens in Paris, it is well taken care of and the perfect spot for a break, to relax, eat your lunch box or even a quick nap

Like quite alot of others, I went to this park to eat falafel!  The entrance is hard to spot, see photo. There are three sections with a couple of benches in the first two sections and around 15 in the final larger area.  Calm and peaceful (except there is clearly a near by school), to take five, with a few things to keep the 4 - 6 year olds busy.

A most interesting public park, with a fabulous old fig tree. We felt like we were entering a secret domain only we knew about - obviously, it's quite easy to find, and lots of people go there, but that's the feel.
Very easy to miss the entrance. It's a nice park but I believe it's way too much surrounded by buildings. It's okay. Therefore 3 stars.

A lovely park in the Jewish quarter with a few pieces of playground equipment for young children. Lots of park benches and some sunny and shady spots to sit and enjoy life in Paris, even better if you are eating a takeaway falafel pitta roll. The park is surrounded on 3 a des by houses and hotels. There is also a community garden here but unfortunately no toilets.
Super nice and quiet place with a memorial near the entrance.
A calm refuge in the heart of a busy district
Not a garden for tourists but a private courtyard. Police are frequently called to remove trespassers.
Small park & playground. Perfect for taking a rest after strolling through Marais.
Entrance is closed today, Saturday - May 2024

A lovely spot to relax and eat my lunch (amazing shawarma from round the corner!). Lots of benches and can also sit on the grass. Lovely shady areas under trees. Lots of bins so no rubbish around. Lovely area which pays homage to the local Jewish people who died during WWII.

Beautiful hidden garden, a real gem if you manage to find it. It’s tucked away in between buildings but once you discover it you will love the peace & quiet, away from the bustling surroundings of shops, tourists. It’s worth a visit if you have some extra time in Paris and if you like to go off the beaten track a little.

Great little park. Feel a bit silly even reviewing it because it’s very rarely got more than half a dozen people in it, when the street outside is packed with tourists milling around and stuffing falafels down their gullets.  Incredibly peaceful spot and very, very easy to miss the entrance. Twice. Even with the address in Google Maps. Maybe it should just stay hidden.
Clean and cosy park. Great to eat your falafel!
don’t waste your time :)

A hidden green spot not known to many, despite it's location in the vibrant Rue des Rosiers. It's best to buy a patisserie or a light, portable lunch (a falafel for example, there are many of those in the area), and go find a spot in this amazing, quiet park and have your meal.
It's pretty secluded which is great and perfect hideout when you wanna take a break from walking the city. It's more beautiful in spring time.
Perfect place to grab a park bench and devour your falafel-in-pita from up the road. Entrances to the park are look like a gate to a courtyard from the road.
Beautiful little tranquil oasis in the heart of the Marais. Perfect for relaxing at lunchtime in the shade surrounded by herbs and flowers.
It's not always open but often on the weekends it is. This secret garden is a lovely stroll and it offers delightful nooks and crannies. The access is via rue Francs Bourgeois.
Perfect place to eat your falafel! It's bigger than it first appears - walk in then turn left after the long wall.
Place to eat a takeout with quiet little garden shielded from traffic. If you don't want to eat on street. Nice place.
A pleasant often quiet little garden to enjoy a quick bite outside the busy streets of marais.
Very nice secret, hidden garden in the heart of paris. It is better to visit weekdays, just walk around or sit in a bench.
Great little park tucked away amongst the buildings. Some nice wooden things for kids including a toy boat.
It's a Great escape from the bussy streets. Perfect waiting spot when your wife enters another shop....
Perfect place to eat the falafel! Tour groups use it to sit and talk. Great for people watching!
Nice little park
A hidden garden of le marias covered by residential Parisian buildings. A quite place to relax and to enjoy a picnic.
Very quiet and very beautiful. Perfect spot to eat your Shawarma.
Very sweet small garden to take a break.
Found this hidden gem close to my place through an FT article. Will be my go-to place to sit down and eat falafel from now!!
Great hidden garden perfect for a picnic.
great little park, cozy, hidden between buildings, with a heavy history.
Nice small garden in a hidden place to relax for some minutes.
An incredible hidden gem - a definite must go
Perfect spot in the pletzl to have a rest and take the time to enjoy Mr Peretz's falafel special.
Love eating falafel in pita on a bench here and people watch too!
